Reviews.Title: MISLEADING REVIEWS
Reviews.Author: Jeremy C
Reviews.Content: DISCLAIMER This review was published when the laptop was priced at 299.MISLEADING REVIEWSI review items (over 160 to date). It's disturbing to see two "reviews" that have nothing to do with the product. This deal popped up from dealnews.com and I was very close to closing the window based on the "horrible" rating. That is clearly unfair. Someone justifying the product gave it a mediocre review and the other person gave the product two stars and didn't even receive or test the product.MY REVIEW IS TO BALANCE THAT OUT AS BEST AS POSSIBLE.If you are looking for a cheap laptop this one certainly meets the spec.Pros:Dealnews.com ranks this as the best priced Pentium laptop of the year (as of 12/2/2013).Asus is a solid and reliable brand. Customer service is stellar (if you do read the original review you can see that Asus directly contacted the reviewer to state that this is a valid product)4.2lbs - On the lighter side of the inexpensive laptop spectrum1366x768 screen resolution is standard. The screen should look as good as any in the $200-$600 price range.HD Camera - Mom will like that for skype. This means I get to actually see my nephew and not the pixelated mess that I've been dealing with :)Intel Pentium 2117U  - Ivy bridge 1.8 GHz is nothing to frown about. It's a generation behind (Haswell being the latest and greatest) but is a solid performer none the less. It is on the lower end of the Ivy bridge spectrum which almost makes me want to put it in the "expected" category, however after months of research I still feel that this is a processor that should go in a slightly more expensive computer ($400-$500 range)..aka you're getting more bang for your buck. Keep in mind that this is a Pentium. In my experience that means all the difference. (see note 1 for an explanation of this processor straight from Intel)Expected:Ram - 4GB is standard. I like my laptops running with 8gbHard Drive - 320GB is also standard for this price pointCons:"HD Cam" - Yes it's in the pro section but I couldn't find the resolution of the webcam. I'd like to know that going in, however it's not a dealbreakerSummary:I am an avid fan of Asus owning both the new Nexus 7 (yes they make that) as well as a small inexpensive portable that I purchased two years ago. I ran a far less powerful Asus model through the ringer with the demand that I placed on it in both Google earth and Microsoft excel (I am a project manager for an LED company that pins light locations on google earth. Thousands of GPS coordinates put quite a demand on the CPU). I couldn't be prouder of how it stood up. It slips right in my briefcase alongside my new Yoga Pro 2 (YP2 = 1,200 my old Asus $250). I still use it for the dirty work (we also install in manufacturing plants).I wanted to just balance out the star rating best that I could but decided to share some of my experience with Asus as a brand as well as the spec breakdown of the laptop. With a premium (Pentium) 1.8ghz processor and standard Ram this computer should run great for daily use. Don't expect it to be your workhorse but something to use for web surfing and some light work. The reason I found myself here was because I am looking to help my mom purchase a laptop. After writing this and researching I feel like I might be purchasing one soon. Updates to follow if I do!Do some spec research before choosing, but please pay no mind to the two original reviews that are posted here.** Note 1 - Intel Pentium 2117U processor defined (notebookcheck.com)-The Intel Pentium 2117U is an Ultra Low Voltage (ULV) dual core processor for entry-level laptops. It is based on the Ivy Bridge architecture but many of the features like Turbo Boost, Virtualization VT-d, HyperThreading, AES or Trusted Execution are deactivated. The Pentium 2117U integrates a graphics card called Intel HD Graphics that is based on the HD Graphics 2500.The performance of the Pentium 2117U is slightly above a similar clocked Sandy Bridge Pentium CPU. Therefore, the performance is just slightly below the 2.0 GHz Pentium B940.Find my review unhelpful? Please let me know why in the comments field. This is my first unowned product review based solely out of need. I do have plenty of experience in computers and would be happy to answer any questions that you have. I pride myself in writing helpful customer reviews for the Amazon Community.Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for everyday tasks
Reviews.Author: rochu168
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy laptop by any means.  But it works very well for everyday tasks such as surfing the web, checking e-mail, organizing photos and YouTube.  This is a Windows 8 laptop without a touch screen.  It does not matter to me since it is connected to a 22" led monitor and used as a desktop.  I installed Classic Shell on the laptop and it works like Windows 7.  I have two ASUS Windows 8 laptops (the other one is ASUS VivoBook X202E-DH31T-SL 11.6-Inch Touchscreen) and log on with my live.com account.  Windows 8 syncs the user settings between the two laptops.The laptop has only two USB ports.  I purchased AmazonBasics USB 2.0 4-Port Ultra Mini Hub so I can connect the mouse, keyboard and other USB accessories.  The product description did not mention it; the laptop has an HDMI and a VGA port.  The newer laptops generally only have the HDMI port.  My older Viewsonic led monitor does not have an HDMI port so the VGA port is good to have.  It comes with an optical drive.  I know, I know, we are not supposed to use DVD's anymore.  But I happen to have old DVD's around and having a built-in optical drive is a plus.  When shopping for a value laptop, make sure to look for at least 4 GB of memory; anything less is not sufficient for today's computing needs.I purchased this laptop on Black Friday Deals Week for a great price.  The five star rating is taking into consideration of performance, value and customer service.  I generally do not need tech support unless the product is defective.  But I notice ASUS replies to the negative ratings.  It shows to me that they care about customer experience.  In summary, this is not a cutting edge laptop with the latest bells and whistles.  But it is a well priced laptop great for everyday tasks.

Reviews.Title: Decent Laptop for Surfing and Minor Tasks
Reviews.Author: Stacy Corbett
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an in expensive PC laptop to replace a 5 year old Dell laptop that was on its last leg.  I primarily use a MacBook Pro for work, but I keep a PC around for my devices and apps that don't play well on a Mac.  I wasn't looking to spend a lot since the PC laptop would have limited use, but I also wanted something that had decent performance and felt like a solid machine.  I've had a lot of luck with ASUS products in the past, and based on the reviews here (and the great price), I purchased this machine.Physically the laptop feels a little cheap b/c it has a plastic body (and the plastic feels like...plastic). It doesn't have a "solid" feel. But this makes it pretty light and easy to carry around.  The keys on the keyboard are smaller than I've seen on other PC laptops from Lenovo or Dell.  It takes some getting used to and I make some keystroke mistakes b/c keys aren't quite in the spot my fingers expect them to be.  It's not a exactly a quiet keyboard, but I feel the sound comes from the plastic body.My biggest complaint about the machine is with the touchpad.  In the machine I received, the touchpad component actually moves a bit in the case. You can move it a little from side to side. It's a little annoying, but so far in contacting ASUS customer support, they don't have a solution for me.  It's also slow to respond to gestures.  When I try to scroll on a webpage, I feel like it takes about 5 seconds for the machine to realize "oh you want to scroll here" and then it works.  Even now writing this review, when trying to move my cursor around this text area, I'm moving my finger on the touchpad, but the cursor doesn't move for about 5 seconds and then it catches up.  ASUS has suggested downloading a bunch of drivers to try and help with this.  Hopefully it will.With 4MB of RAM it's not a screaming fast machine, but it's perfectly fine for surfing and basic tasks.  It boots really fast and in doing general web stuff, I haven't noticed any kind of performance issues.It comes with Windows 8, but you'll want to download Windows 8.1 from the store.  It takes a LONG time to download and install.  And you'll need to make sure the machine doesn't go to sleep while this is all happening.If this was going to be my primary machine and be used daily, I might return it b/c of the touchpad issues I have.  But since it's not,  I'll keep it b/c of the price. Other machines with similar specs are going for $100 more at least.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my Asus Laptop Purchase
Reviews.Author: shawn
Reviews.Content: I picked up this laptop on Black Friday Deals Week. After using it for about a week, I am very happy with my purchase. For some of the people doubting stuff about it, it does have a HDMI port and a optical disc drive. The screen is vibrant and clear, the speakers sound great, the touchpad/mouse is sensitive and responsive, and the keys have a nice feel to them. I am glad I picked this laptop up on the Black Fridays Deals Week.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what it should be for the price.
Reviews.Author: K. Miran
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my father-in-law so that he could do the required work for his Master's classes on the go. For internet-based tasks such as checking email, browsing, and working on his online courses it does quite well. The build quality, however, leaves something to be desired.Design and Build Quality - If you're familiar with the structure and layout of a Macbook Pro, the body of the computer looks very similar (even the charger looks like an Apple brick) - the difference is that the entire thing is made out of plastic. As a result, both the keyboard and touchpad feel less substantial than I would like (the touchpad even jiggles a bit when you click it), and the whole thing just generally feels a little fragile. Still, this is exactly what I would expect from a sub-$300 laptop such as this, so it's not a surprise - I just don't expect this laptop to last for years. The upshot of all this, is that the laptop itself is extremely light and easy to carry around. The keyboard itself is also satisfyingly clicky (if a bit loud), and the touchpad works well enough. All that said, If you're looking for a machine that instills confidence when you use it, you might want to look elsewhere.Performance: Time will tell in this area, but so far, so good. It does come with some pre-loaded software that you'll want to uninstall and replace, but I've definitely seen worse. Processor's a bit on the slow side, but, again, that's not unexpected. 4GB of RAM will be more than adequate to do anything you need to. It does come with Windows 8 (not 8.1) pre-installed, so you'll need to update it when it arrives.Lastly, for the negative reviews that say this model number doesn't exist, I had my doubts as well, but I'm typing from one right now, so that's obviously not a problem.Overall, I'm pleased with the purchase. For the computer's expected uses, it should do just fine - just don't expect it to last that long.

Reviews.Title: Asus...just the worst, I mean horrible!
Reviews.Author: Gift Card Recipient "Glenn Penner"
Reviews.Content: Just the worst! I bought this laptop for my wife for Christmas. She's a PC person and I'm a Mac guy. She just wanted a simple machine to access the internet, check e-mail, and basic word processing. After about three weeks, half of the screen completely went blank. After several restarts, and dealing with Asus tech support it was determined that we needed to send the laptop back to Asus. After about 10 days, Asus sent the laptop back to us with a letter stating the device (about a month old) was not under warranty because of preexisting damage. The letter further stated that an attached page would show pictures of the damage. We'll guess what?! There was no attached page with pictures, likely because there was no external or previous damage. Oh and get this,,,there was chocolate (not from us) on the top of the laptop. Seriously!? Your chubby, candy bar munching, technician got his Baby Ruth remnants on my laptop and now you are telling me the (very new) laptop is not under warranty. If I'm ever forced to buy a PC again, it certainly won't be from Asus.

Reviews.Title: Good Value for the Money
Reviews.Author: Richard Evans Lee "Compulsive webmaster and b...
Reviews.Content: I bought this PC for browsing the web, dealing with email, text and HTML editing and simple photomanipulation.This laptop is suited to all those tasks. The machine is prompt and responsive.One surprise is the monitor is more than I was hoping for in a cheap laptop.My criteria were: reliable brand, 4GB of ram with upgrade possible, good warranty and as cheap as possible. Those conditions were perfectly satisfied with this PC.I've used every version of Windows since NT. Upgrading to 8.1, installing all my old software went fine. No compatibility problems.Sticking with the desktop and taskbar has been effortless so the different UI hasn't bothered me at all.

Reviews.Title: suprised and shocked by great quality
Reviews.Author: TINA-BUM-BUM
Reviews.Content: don't let the 2 reviews fool you or the picture.. i ordered this laptop for my fiance for christmas and we absolutely love it ..it runs smooth has a great camera and its perfect for someone who is on a fixed budget. i will eventually be getting one of these i was expecting far less quality for the picture and a few previous reviews i saw.. i absolutely love it and so does my fiance since they got it they have not put it down... i would definitely recommend this to anyone who needs a laptop but has limited funds .. you get your moneys worth out of it ..

Reviews.Title: This is a pretty awesome laptop... until you need to remove the battery
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: At first I must say that this laptop is really good for the money.  It won't play games or nothing but if you need to surf some internet or write a term paper this baby is the ticket.That was until I plugged my wife's Note 3 into the USB-3 port and it shut down.  Then it wouldn't start.  So I did what you normally do in this situation.  I pulled the battery in order to reset the laptop.So where is the battery you might ask?  Under the keyboard.  That's right under the flipping keyboard.  So 2 ribbon cables and a heart attack later I was able to get to the battery, remove it, and the thing came back to life.  Well, came back to life after an hour of trying to reconnect ribbon cables.  Ribbon cables.  Why did it have to be ribbon cables?While we are on the subject of ribbon cables let me ask you this ASUS... why?  Why do you need a ribbon cable for a power button?  It's a button.  Tell your engineering department I said KISS.  Your engineer's will know what I mean.  On second thought they probably won't.  I know that you're capable of building a seven stage nuclear powered rocked that will get you to work.  You're smart.  I'm proud of you.  Now stop.  Just stop.Why make a case that doesn't allow for the removal of the battery?  I could see taking these steps if it somehow cut down costs or weight.  I don't see how it can.  A case with a hole in it would cost just about the same as a case without a hole.  Holes are free and they weigh less.  Win and win.My other ASUS laptop has a fully removable battery and only costs $100 more.  The hard drive and RAM are easily removed too.  It is more than worth $100 to get a better laptop that is well constructed.I'm disappointed ASUS.  You can do better than this.  You have done better than this.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, just the right performance
Reviews.Author: Christian De Freitas
Reviews.Content: This is a very capable entry level laptop, it's based on the Ivy Bridge Architecture, basically this is a Core i3 with neither Hyperthreading nor Turbo Boost.It comes with a very nice, glossy 14 inch with the same resolution as the 15.6 inch, meaning you get more pixels per inch resulting in a very nice screen experience.This machine has 2 slots for RAM sticks but only one is occupied, meaning that to upgrade to 8gb all you have to do is add a second stick. The RAM type is DDR3 http://amzn.to/1jyDBAgYou'll find a nice surprise, this laptop has an Optical Drive, HDMI and VGA port. Sadly there's no Bluetooth, but solvable with a dongle if you really need it http://amzn.to/1rmvCQy .This one is not touchscreen, but that's really gimmick for me.On the USB department, there is only 2 of them, one is 2.0 and the other 3.0.There is really no competition, no other laptop at this price point can match the performance. Price wise, the closest is the chromebook http://amzn.to/1lVYOpj but this is one way better than a chromebook

Reviews.Title: Got 1st one that didn't work right after opening.
Reviews.Author: Victor
Reviews.Content: Got 1st one. It didn't work, things like that do happened so not a big deal, Amazon sended me a replacement.  This second one, doesn't work either. My daughter is disappointed and I'm not very happy either (It was supposed to be one of her Xmas presents). I'm giving up on the item, will try a local store to buy a working laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great for the college student!
Reviews.Author: T. Davis
Reviews.Content: Read a number of reviews and comparisons online and definitely not disappointed. My son, a new college student, really needed a laptop of his own and this fit the bill in his ability to use for all of his classes, being small/light enough to carry all day, and equipped with everything he needed in a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Using it right now
Reviews.Author: Pat "Pat"
Reviews.Content: Works great - perfect for laptop playing while watching TV..  It's a toy for me - but definitely capable of more!

Reviews.Title: Good fast laptop
Reviews.Author: David E. McAlister
Reviews.Content: I like this laptop a lot, but the battery life is a little disappointing. I like the size of the screen and light weight. It fits me just fine.

Reviews.Title: Good... not so Good!!
Reviews.Author: Edward Pendleton
Reviews.Content: This is a double edged sword... it cuts both ways. One thing is that it doesn't have a consumer changeable battery... good and bad.. if you need a new battery you need to get someone to replace it... but it makes the unit very slim, lite, easy to use; then on the other hand if the battery lasts 3 years, you will probably get another laptop by then. If you don't use the touch pad for a minute or so it sometimes seems to not respond right away, and you need to keep touching or tapping the touch pad to finally get it respond to your touch, then it is OK. Quite annoying actually. There is no way to adjust the touch pad sensitivity also. Had quite an issue with the "Gesture Pad Functions" software for about two weeks.. talked to Asus techs.. they keep having me reinstall the drivers.. after about six times or so the Gesture functions are now working only if I let the unit boot up completely before using the laptop. If I use the laptop as soon as the desktop appears there is a 50/50 chance the Gesture pad functions won't come up and will need to restart PC to get them to start. Over all my biggest complaint with this laptop is the issues concerning the touch pad. They are at sometimes annoying and frustrating, and then the touch pad operates like it should for quite a long time. This leads to the fact there is no HDD function light or indicator to know when the laptop has completed booting up or if there is HDD activity going on that may indicate why something is taking time to happen. I solved this by installing a small program I found for free on line called "HDD Activity Light" A small flashing icon by the system clock now shows the HDD activity.Now.. other than these annoying little issues; the laptop for the uses that I got it for works out rather well. Once the Gesture Pad Functions are working the laptop performs quite nicely. It has an older CPU, 4 GB ram, 500Gb HDD. Given these shortcomings, given the lite uses I need this laptop for, surfing internet, paying bills, streaming movies from Netflix, editing photos, it is pretty snappy and responsive. The battery last between 3-4 hours with average use.. not great.. but not too bad also.Would I recommend this laptop? Good question... I'm conflicted.. it has issues that I'm OK with, and I'm getting used to them. For me it is not a deal breaker, I wouldn't return the laptop because of these issues. Would someone else want to cope with these niggling issues I don't know. When the unit runs good, it runs really good. When it acts up, it is a pain till it gets into the swing of things.

Reviews.Title: First Windows 8 Computer
Reviews.Author: Jacky
Reviews.Content: My sister wanted a cheap simple laptop that was good enough to handle videos, few games, and basic web browsing. This laptop easily met her expectations in all aspects.If this is your first windows 8 computer from a windows 7, just upgrade to windows 8.1 and delete all the apps and pin "normal" start menu items in the start menu and use it normally. There's little difference in the versions besides the performance. After the upgrade you get a bit more options.Booting to the desktop doesn't take very long, I was planning on throwing in a cheap 120 GB SSD for even faster performance but the bottom is not accessible. I would take it apart but that would void warranty and I would have no idea how to install the OS back onto the SSD. If the battery does end up dying then there would be no simple way to fix it.The charger looks like a square block (knock off apple's power brick) with 2 prongs sticking out. I'm concerned about ripping the prongs off after tripping over the cable. The charger is also not compact, when trying to put the charger away, unlike apple's you cannot flip the prongs into the block.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working - twice
Reviews.Author: RyansMom
Reviews.Content: Ordered laptop for Christmas gift; within a month it stopped working.  Amazon replaced, now three months later the same problem occurs and machine stopped working again.  Not worth the money or aggravation

Reviews.Title: ASUS is A Winner
Reviews.Author: C. Reeves
Reviews.Content: 4 GB of RAM means it surfs the internet fast. Windows 8 is not as annoying as I thought it would be.  just have to learn how to navigate the screen.  Good little system for a great price.  Very happy with the laptop and Amazon's service.

Reviews.Title: So happy with my laptop
Reviews.Author: Jilly
Reviews.Content: My fiancée got me this laptop and I love it. It's so easy for me to use it whenever and anywhere I go. It has same windows as my computer so not hard for me to use the laptop and better for me to use it anytime instead of use computer all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Jani Skirvin
Reviews.Content: It has good graphics and adaptability. Needs a longer life battery. Hate the built mouse so I plug in a mouse and it works great

Reviews.Title: Really good choise
Reviews.Author: Franz Chacon
Reviews.Content: This laptop is really fast, good graphics, I recommend this for any gammer cuz the RAM memmory the volume is not so high, but it's ok.

Reviews.Title: A little slower than I expected, but overall a decent machine for the price
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer and a wireless mouse and keyboard to hook up to my daughter and son-in-laws TV so they could watch hulu and cartoon network on their TV since they do not have cable.  It has an HDMI port so it really has a nice, clear graphic on their HDTV when using a HDMI cable to hook them together.  It can play online videos seamlessly, but only if no other programs are running. Wish it had a little more "juice", but it does good for how inexpensive it was.  Also a word on Windows 8.  My daughter and I have never used Windows 8.  We figured it out in about 20-30 minutes.  We even changed the font size to a larger font to make it easier to see on the TV when they are on their couch.  So don't be afraid of it just because of the new operating system.

Reviews.Title: Review and comment for Jeremy C
Reviews.Author: franklis "lisa ramos"
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop because my daughter kept insisting I buy a laptop for us to do some research on colleges we both want to attend and I was in doubt first but then decided to buy it because of the price(since I can't afford an expensive one because I'm currently unemployed),I fell in love with it the second day, it's light weight,HD and my favorite Windows 8, it's a good buy. Now for Jeremy C comment, I'm really glad I read it review as I see u are a very fair reviewer,I just wanted to know did I make the right decision to buy it, another thing(u seem to know a lot about computers) what do I look in a laptop to know it's a reliable and good one????I really appreciate an honest answer.  Thank you very much!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Not great, but I could afford decent, this is decent :)
Reviews.Author: Jacob Public
Reviews.Content: bit slow if you have a.d.d. like I do as you keep half a dozen windows open and a dozen or more internet tabs...Not it's fault, I just use it different than it is meant to be...I had a tad trouble hooking to the internet/setup, etc but it was resolved within an hour or so... no biggie...Pretty satisfied :)

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: misty munoz
Reviews.Content: So I was looking for a LAPTOP to use in my collage class to do things like research, typing out essays, and printing but ended up getting this.  With the built in disc drive I was able to load the needed drivers so I could use my printer.  Just a few things I liked about it is, light weight and as long as I'm not on the internet the battery lasts about 4hrs and recharges fast, typically I walked into class with a full charge and by lunch I could charge it full during my lunch hour.  Even though it's not what I was looking for it works very well.

Reviews.Title: Never mind any negativity
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: I've seen mostly good reviews for this laptop, and after shopping around, we decided on this. I will be using it for work, and expect it will do perfectly fine. Windows 8 is a nice environment, Takes some getting used to, but most new things do. I understand where the touch screen feature would maybe have been easier for WIN 8 but it's fine. So far it is a GIANT LEAP fromthe Lenovo T61 I was using. VERY quiet, and fast. I am not a gamer, but the 14 inch screen does look really good for graphics, etc...Played some youtube videos and everything looks good too.

Reviews.Title: Great price
Reviews.Author: BOSSA
Reviews.Content: Wow all this and a great price,so many add ons that cost keep you from using the comp for weeks

Reviews.Title: OK but wouldn't buy again
Reviews.Author: CustomerAmz
Reviews.Content: It's ok but not great. Based on the reviews thought it was great. What a mistake. Pros: Speakers produce nice sound, starts up quickly, has optical drive, decent internet speed. If I had to do it over, I would not buy it again just to save $ even though I am using it only for basic computing needs. Cons: Keys sometimes mistype/won't function properly,  Mouse gets froze & won't  move, and sometimes won't click on link. Screen zooms in/out on its own sporadically.  Windows 8 tool bar sporadically pops up many times even without clicking which is annoying. Battery life is not 4 hours, maybe 1.5 hrs max. Must keep laptop on charger. Ok for those on a budget but if you won't a quality laptop (even a basic one), you can do better than this one. In fairness,some of these things could be related to windows 8 software but the majority are not.

Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: Anne Dufilho
Reviews.Content: The notebook was not as user friendly as I would have liked but I am not that tech savvy. Not sure if I should blame it on the computer or Windows 8 but it takes a lot of using to get use to it. It is the perfect size and is sharp looking. I would highly recommend this to almost anyone.

Reviews.Title: On it now write this review.
Reviews.Author: wayne g.
Reviews.Content: this item came well packaged and was exactly what I was expecting. I would gladly do business with this vendor again.The item buttons seem a little fragile but otherwise this PC does all I  need especially for the money. Haven't gamed but it is working well for internet!

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel Pentium 2117U 1.8 GHz
4 GB DDR3
320 GB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
14.0-Inch Screen
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: ASUS D450CA-AH21 14-Inch Laptop (Black)
